    ! Check if current number has '3', '5', and '7'

    has3 = .false. has5 = .false.
    has7 = .false. integer :: k
    do k = 1, l
      select case (s_str(k:k))
        case ('3')
          has3 = .true.
        case ('5')
          has5 = .true.
        case ('7')
          has7 = .true.
      end select
    end do
    if (has3 .and. has5 .and. has7) then
      c = c + 1

    ! Compose next_i by the algorithm

    integer :: current_length = 0
    logical :: f = .false.

          f = .true.
        case ('5')

          new_str(current_length:current_length) = '7'

        case ('7')

    if (.not.f) then
      current_length = current_length + 1
      new_str(current_length:current_length) = '3'
    end if

    ! Reverse to get next number
    character(20) :: rev_str = " "
    integer :: cl = current_length
    integer :: j
    do j = 1, current_length
      rev_str(j:j) = new_str(cl - j + 1: cl - j +1 )
    end do

    ! Convert to integer
    read(rev_str(1:cl), *) next_i

    i = next_i
  end do

program atcoder_abc114_c

  implicit none

  integer(8) :: N, i, next_i, c

  c = 0

  read(*, *) N

  i = 357_8

  ! Continue while i is not exceeding N

  do while (i <= N)
    character(20) :: s_str
    write(s_str, '(I20)') i
    s_str = adjustl(s_str)
    integer :: l = len_trim(s_str)

    ! Check if current number has '3', '5', and '7'
    logical :: has3, has5, has7
    has3 = .false.
    has5 = .false.
    has7 = .false.
    integer :: k
    do k = 1, l
      select case (s_str(k:k))
        case ('3')
          has3 = .true.
        case ('5')
          has5 = .true.
        case ('7')
          has7 = .true.
      end select
    end do
    if (has3 .and. has5 .and. has7) then
      c = c + 1
    end if

    ! Compose next_i by the algorithm
    character(20) :: new_str
    integer :: current_length = 0
    logical :: f = .false.
    ! Process each character in reverse order
    do i_char = l, 1, -1
      character(1) :: current_char = s_str(i_char:i_char)
      if (.not. f) then
        select case (current_char)
        case ('3')
          current_length = current_length + 1
          new_str(current_length:current_length) = '5'
          f = .true.
        case ('5')
          current_length = current_length + 1
          new_str(current_length:current_length) = '7'
          f = .true.
        case ('7')
          current_length = current_length + 1
          new_str(current_length:current_length) = '3'
        end select
      else
        current_length = current_length + 1
        new_str(current_length:current_length) = current_char
      end if
    end do

    if (.not.f) then
      current_length = current_length + 1
      new_str(current_length:current_length) = '3'
    end if

    ! Reverse to get next number
    character(20) :: rev_str = " "
    integer :: cl = current_length
    integer :: j
    do j = 1, current_length
      rev_str(j:j) = new_str(cl - j + 1: cl - j +1 )
    end do

    ! Convert to integer
    read(rev_str(1:cl), *) next_i

    i = next_i
  end do

  ! Output the count
  print*, c

end program atcoder_abc114_c
